loans.title: Cynthia
loans.description: A loan of $575 helps Sau to buy a chainsaw, banana tubes (seedlings), taro roots (seedlings), a wheelbarrow, a water tank, gloves, a rake, a shovel, and chemicals.

loans.title: Senia Del Carmen
loans.description: A portion of Tuzamurane Group's $6,800 loan helps a member to buy more sorghum for sale.

loans.title: Emprendedoras Group
loans.description: A loan of $575 helps Intissar to pay her children’s educational fees.

loans.title: Lillian
loans.description: A loan of $600 helps Narciso to buy supplies for agricultural work and carpentry tools.

loans.title: Mirian Yamileh
loans.description: A portion of Sareoun's Group's $225 loan helps a member to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.title: Estebana Sofia
loans.description: A loan of $225 helps Ganga to purchase a dairy cow for starting her milk-selling business.

loans.title: Juvenal
loans.description: A loan of $400 helps Juliana to pay university fees.

loans.title: Abel Amauris
loans.description: A loan of $1,525 helps Jessica to pay the fees for the course of study.

loans.title: Nhóm 14 Thôn 3 Quảng Nhân Group
loans.description: A loan of $375 helps Mele to pay for her daughter’s university tuition fee.

loans.title: Marie Fatini's Group
loans.description: A loan of $3,000 helps Yocasta Magaly to pay the expenses to finish her studies and also to pay for an English course.

loans.title: Karanjung Lestari 2 Group
loans.description: A loan of $1,500 helps Eda to buy 5 sacks of rice, 2 sacks of sugar, 5 boxes of canned goods, 10 cases of soft drinks and electronic load to sell to her store.

loans.title: Narkul
loans.description: A portion of Ndugu Nipe Shauri B Group's $6,000 loan helps a member to stock up on wheat, sugar, Omo soap, and cooking oil.
